Overtime Pay for All - It’s About Time.

Dear Editor,

The recent movement by the president to require all workers who work over 40 hours per week to be paid overtime is a brilliant idea! Until now, many large retailers, fast-food restaurants, and other low-wage employers have been able to require salaried workers to work 50 hours per week or more without paying them overtime. Many of these salaried workers make just above minimum wage as it is. It is really just a simple trick for big companies to get free work from their employees. That just doesn’t seem fair, does it? Some might argue that companies might have to lay off workers or even pay them lower wages. But these companies make billions of dollars a year in profit. Why shouldn’t they share more of it? I, for one, am glad the president stepped in and did something about it.


Ophelia Payne
Dentville
